title: Zone of Proximal Development Visualization
description: An interactive visualization of Vygotsky's Zone of Proximal Development showing three concentric learning zones (Can Do Independently, ZPD, Cannot Do Yet) with adjustable scaffolding level and MicroSim feature mapping.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Education
Educational Psychology
Instructional Design
Learning Theory
learningObjectives: Identify the three zones in Vygotsky's ZPD model
Explain how scaffolding expands the Zone of Proximal Development
Understand the implications of ZPD for instructional design
Recognize how MicroSim features map to different learning zones

controls.description: Adjust scaffolding level (0-100%) to see how support expands the ZPD
Hover over zones to see detailed descriptions and examples
Toggle visibility of MicroSim feature mapping

assumptions: Three-zone model based on Vygotsky's original theory
limitations: Does not show dynamic progression of zones over time
Simplified representation of complex cognitive development theory
theoreticalBasis: Vygotsky's sociocultural theory of cognitive development (1978)
